Reviews.Title: Good phone for someone who doesn't need Data
Reviews.Author: gadget_geek
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife, who needs a simple phone that can make and receive calls, send and receive text messages, and play her favorite MP3 in addition to the ubiquitous FM Radio. This phone fulfills all those needs, and still has more to offer with 3G and Bluetooth support. The User interface is quite simple and yet looks cool. The candy-bar phone isn't too big or thick and fits well in your denim's pockets. There is just one minor thing which we don't quite like - the keypad. Its a single sheet of metal and its kinda difficult to press. We really need to press very hard in order to punch the numbers/letters. Other than that, a great device.

Reviews.Title: Works overseas, in countries that support the GSM band ranges this phone has
Reviews.Author: Bruce C Huang
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Asia, visiting 2 countries.  I did research to ensure this phone is supposed to have the bandwidth to support the wireless spectrums used by those 2 countries.  Since the phone was already unlocked, I simply purchased a SIM local to the country, pop the SIM in, and activated the SIM/phone #.  Wholla!  Works like a charm.  Called local to the country and back to USA.  Sound quality is crystal clear.  A friend could not even tell I was almost half way around the world when we chatted.The back case is a bit tough to open initially.  The back cover will only slide downwards for a few millimeters, where then you can lift the cover to access the battery and the SIM slot.  After the first couple of times, the stickiness wears off.You can then go to the Nokia website to download their Ovi Suite software, where you can transfer data between your phone and computer via USB cable.It would have been nice (would have been willing to pay a little more) for the vendor to have included the USB data/charger cable with the phone.  I had to locate and purchase it separately on a different website.The one weakness of the phone is that there is no quick way to change volume without taking the phone away from the ear.

Reviews.Title: Frustrating
Reviews.Author: Peditab
Reviews.Content: Pros:* The phone has a clean and simple design. The navigation menu isn't cluttered like most other phones these days.* The call quality is decent, and the screen is bright.* Bluetooth works as it should.CONS... Here we go...* The battery life is sub-par. An hour-long call is enough to bring the battery life down to half-charge. One of the methods the manual offers to conserve battery life is to lower the brightness of the display. The thing is, YOU CAN'T. There is NO OPTION ANYWHERE in the display menu or any other area to control the brightness of the screen (and it is bright).* There is no way to control the size and layout of the time and date on the main screen. This is especially annoying when you want to gaze at the lovely wallpaper you install. The only way around this is to hide the clock and the date completely.* The phone does not come with its own USB to connect to the PC. This is important, because you (supposedly) NEED to update the software on this phone when you get it or you will run into problems like being unable to receive and send multimedia text messages. The Nokia website states that you can update directly from the phone itself but only with some models. Apparently, they decided not to have that convenience with the 2730, so the only way to update is through a PC connection. Of course, you can't use just any usb connector. I have no idea what this particular inlet model is called but I took a picture of it and will post it in the product photos.I currently am unable to send or receive multimedia messages and had to work it out with AT&T; for quite a while to come up with a solution, which we didn't. The multimedia messages menu won't even allow me to mess around with the Configuration Settings to configure my service provider. My only option is to install the update and hope for the best but, of course, it didn't come with the USB.If it weren't for these issues, I would have given it four stars.

Reviews.Title: OK Basic Phone
Reviews.Author: Ryzeldorf "Ryzeldorf"
Reviews.Content: After using the phone for a week now I thought it time to post a review. I ordered direct from Nokia for ninety-nine bucks and found a code for free shipping. I am using the phone on the T-Mobile network.First off reception and call quality is great. It paired easily with my Plantronics Blue Tooth earpiece. The battery life seems great to me. I make about 10 calls a day totaling an hour or so. I have not reduced the battery by a single bar. So I'd say that's pretty good. If you want a bare bones candy bar phone this is an excellent choice.On the negative side, there is no way to access 3G/4G speed for the web on this phone. It needs to be pre-configured when built to accomodate this and T-Mobile does not have the ability to go beyond simple GPRS web speed which is SLOW. So DO NOT buy this phone to access the web on T-Mobile.Overall a solid choice for a no frills phone. Very light and simple to use.UPDATE 2.18.11: I've been using the phone daily for a month now and I love it. Very reliable, cannot drain the battery and has rock solid reception.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone.
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: Call quality is great for me and the person I'm calling. Speakerphone quality is excellent. Reception is great on T-Mobile. Screen is small but gorgeous and the design is very sharp. This phone does what I want it to do and looks great doing it. Another thing to consider is that accessories (i.e. extra charger, car charger, hands free, etc.) are very reasonably priced compared to some other brands. I'll be heading to the UK soon and love that I'll be able to use this phone there as well.My previous phone was an iPhone. It was great, but once the novelty wore off I found it was more than I really needed. I don't care for all the bells & whistles. I just want to make calls and send texts. Maybe snap a picture or two. This gets the job done fairly inexpensively. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Helen Billingham "HelenB"
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased this phone for our son.  He has many hand held gadgets and just wanted a basic phone.  He likes the phone, however, it can neither send nor receive photos via text message.  He says the signal is fair but not great either.  He is happy with it and it serves as a great no fuss phone but for those 2 minor flaws.  It's a great price for a basic phone.

Reviews.Title: backup
Reviews.Author: Patrica A. McLoughlin "Pat McLoughlin"
Reviews.Content: Received phone within time period; works well with my bluetooth.  Only problem is the camera.  Images are not as clear as my other phone, but will suffice for my needs.  Easy to operate and would probably purchase again if necessary.

Reviews.Title: Works well-good price
Reviews.Author: EC
Reviews.Content: I was traveling through Europe and needed a phone that will work in various countries, and this did the trick. It worked in Spain, Germany, Hungary, Bosnia and Croatia. I didn't use any of the functions other than calling and texting so I cannot comment on those, but the phone is nice, lightweight, looks good and it worked.

Reviews.Title: Cool product!
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: If youre looking for a solid cell phone from Nokia this is a great choice! But the volume is so low its hard to hear!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Radio, Speakers and Good MP3 player
Reviews.Author: Medici
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone from Bell, in Canada, 2 years ago, as a pay as you go phone. I've since let the coverage expire, but here in the US I use the phone as a radio and mp3 player, it has truly great sound for a tiny device! You can listen to it for over 10 hours as a radio, which pleases me to no end, there aren't and weren't ever many portable radios with that capacity. It may also play that long as an mp3 player. And even though I seldom play games, I've played the ones on this phone. It also has a good series of alarms. It works great as a phone. The photos and video are OK, I'd say the video recorder is better than the camera. But for the sound quality and if you like listening to music without annoying, painful, un-natural, and hearing destructive headphones or earbuds, it's hard to beat this device. It took the smarties at Apple a while to realize an external speaker is a good idea, Nokia knew that right away. This is a superb device in all aspects and gives you everything you need, short of being a smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Nokia
Reviews.Author: Desmond  Crosby
Reviews.Content: Awesome! Love it. Had it in Ireland and have here in the USA. Love it. No complaints. Decent battery life depends on usage of phone.

Reviews.Title: a fine phone for voice (works with bluetooth GPS too)
Reviews.Author: Andrew I. Jewett
Reviews.Content: Pros: Price ($90). Decent audio quality.  Good reception.  Bright, high resolution screen (small, however), the GPS map software actually works. (But it needs extra hardware.  See below.  Voice recorder and camera are functional.  Does not come with the AT&T; ringtone/startup sound.Cons: Battery life is short.  Does get quite warm. Does not support large memory cards (I read 4GB max. I'm using a 2GB card).  It's not an iphone.  I would not dream of using this to browse the web or send email.  Calendar has a loud irritating alert sound.I've had it for 5 months.  It works perfectly for what I wanted.  It is incomparably better than the chintzy samsung freebie I had before.  As for the GPS, the maps are stored offline, so the GPS feature does not require an expensive data plan.  The OVI PC software you need to download the maps is actually not that bad.  You must have a 2GB memory card and a separate bluetooth GPS receiver, and a special cable to connect the PC to the phone USB CA101 Connectivity Cable.  For the GPS receiver, I'm using a Holux M-1000 32 Channel Wireless Bluetooth GPS Receiver, but any newer holux bluetooth GPS receiver would probably work too.

Reviews.Title: vijayalbert
Reviews.Author: spidy
Reviews.Content: good one , i already have this mobile - so i ordered one for my father . Sound is good and camera is not that much , only limited.

Reviews.Title: trouble
Reviews.Author: wrangler
Reviews.Content: liked the phone, but after a week or two the screen went crazy in the middle of a call and I could not see half the screen.....returned it and got another one... after a week I could barely hear sound out of the speaker.....worked fine if I had my bluetooth on...so I sent this one back.....third one would NOT recognize my SIM card - so I gave up!

Reviews.Title: Decent phone while it worked
Reviews.Author: G. Altvater
Reviews.Content: I bought the phone 4 months ago and it worked great until now. It has all the functions I needed and then some. The phone itself looks good, however it feels a little cheap with the plastic housing. My wife has a similar Nokia phone, however her housing is made out of metal. I didn't think much of it until now. The phone slipped out of my hand and hit the ground from around 4 feet. Not sure if it was an unlucky fall, but the screen broke on the inside. You can't tell that it's broken, unless the backlighting is on. The phone is completely useless to me. The whole thing is really strange, given that, at one time or other, I've dropped all my cell phones. The worst thing that has ever happened was the battery cover popping off. I seems that with this phone, the screen is super sensitive. If you buy this, I would highly recommend also buying some sort of padded case.

Reviews.Title: Warning: Product description incorrect - No GPS
Reviews.Author: JK "JK"
Reviews.Content: While this is a fine phone, there is a serious error in the product description. The phone does NOT have GPS as listed. Straight from the product manual: "Your device does not have an internal GPS antenna. To use applications that require a GPS connection, use a compatible external GPS receiver (accessory sold separately). Pair the GPS receiver with your device using Bluetooth wireless technology." This is, obviously, useless. [Update: Because of this, Amazon offered a 20% credit or returning the phone for a full refund.]Also, like other users have reported, we were unable to receive MMS messages, until updating the firmware to the latest version (v10.45). This was particularly problematic for us, as our service provider's welcome message was in MMS format. However, to update the software you need to find and purchase a Nokia CA-101 data cable, which is not included (as others have stated) and download and install Nokia Ovi Suite (the Nokia Device Update or Nokia PC Suite software packages will not provide updates for this phone).UPDATE:Upon our return to the U.S. I contacted Amazon to discuss the incorrect product description re. GPS. We were offered the choice of a 20% credit and keeping the phone or returning the phone for a full refund. That is good customer service! I still wish the phone had GPS, but I'm upping the review to three stars.

Reviews.Title: GPS doesn't really mean GPS
Reviews.Author: D. N. Brown
Reviews.Content: I'm mostly happy with this phone, as it does the quad-band, world-wide stuff very well. However, I thought the letters "GPS" in the product description meant full GPS abilities. Here's what the Nokia 2730 user's manual has to say about this: "Your device does not have an internal GPS antenna. To use applications that require a GPS connection, use a compatible external GPS receiver (accessory sold separately). Pair the GPS receiver with your device using Bluetooth wireless technology."I wish I'd known this before I bought the phone - I feel cheated.

Reviews.Title: EXELENT phone !
Reviews.Author: JOSEPH
Reviews.Content: I am very with this phone does everything I need from the moment it arrived started making phone calls and playing my music.

Reviews.Title: Wont Disappoint
Reviews.Author: Dood Guy
Reviews.Content: First phone I ordered showed up DOA. Although it did take a charge, it wouldn't turn on afterwards. Replacement phone works great. Quad band ensure's you can pretty much use it anywhere in the world. Phone has about 5-6 days on standby with a full charge. A good phone for travelling with. Returning defective phone was a breeze with amazon. I had my replacement before I could even get the defective phone to ups!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: oregon11
Reviews.Content: The alarm does not work.  The phone heats up so much after five minutes of conversation that it's hard to hold.  The sound quality is very low and there is no volume adjustment.  The battery started running out in two days with basically one hour talking time per day.  I'm not sure but maybe they sent me a refurbished phone.  If not, this is a very bad phone.

Reviews.Title: IT MET MY NEEDS
Reviews.Author: K.R. "K.R."
Reviews.Content: I had all types of phones previously. The latest was BB Pearl which I liked. It happened that I sank the old phone in the pool and decided to go back to a basic reliable phone. I purchased it Unlocked directly from Nokia (about the same price).I bought it primarily for talking and that's all I do with it. Battery life is good. Bluetooth works fine. Four GSM standards make this phone international. I don't do messaging much nor taking pictures. I had it for almost a year now and satisfied so far.

Reviews.Title: the phone last around a year or so
Reviews.Author: King Xie
Reviews.Content: i had this phone from 2011 to 2012.it only lasted a year. the screen would stop working after a few drops on the ground.

Reviews.Title: correction
Reviews.Author: Lily M.
Reviews.Content: a few months back i was finally able to get internet on my phone by following Opera mini's instructions on the "help" section of their website. The phone works perfectly fine and the delivery was excellent :-).

Reviews.Title: Good phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Whoami
Reviews.Content: The phone is really good for the price with the features it has...I thought of buying couple more..but they were out of stock...

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price
Reviews.Author: AA
Reviews.Content: This just goes to show that Europe gets better phones.  Any american phone for this quality would easily be over $150, and even then would most likely have some of these features cut.

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2730 Unlocked
Reviews.Author: P. Le
Reviews.Content: My wife just need a basic, reliable phone.  Ordered it via Amazon.  It came with a household charger, headphone.  I order a silicon skin from Ebay for $2.00.  Nice phone.  My wife loves it.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced.
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: You can BUY this phone, without a contract at a tmobile store for 50 dollars. I know this because that's what I did. This is very overpriced. and the phone isn't the best quality.
